IRD says Pak’nSave follows law by demanding personal details for $1000-plus shopping bills https://www.nzherald.co.nz/nz/ird-says-paknsave-follows-follows-follows-by-demanding-personal-details-for-1000-plus-shopping-bills/6acu6mqdrzeudhzci3zbfpggegq/ https://www.nzherald.co.nz/nz/ird-says-paknsave-follows-follows-follows-by-demanding-personal-details-for-1000-plus-shopping-bills/6acu6mqdrzeudhzci3zbfpggegq/ Nazahryth BernardThe little-known rule has caught multiple people out. Tue, 04 Mar 2025 20:11:26 +0000 Pak'nSave claims it was following the rules when staff asked for personal tax information from a shopper who spent more than $1000 in a shop. Photo / Greg Bowker
Man ‘arbitrarily detained’ by military police rejects NZDF’s ‘insulting’ compensation offer https://www.nzherald.co.nz/nz/man-man-unlawlawlatel-det-by-military-police-rejects-nzdfs-nzdfs-sindulting-compensation-compensation-compensation offer/ZKXIZ3CFVVZEPVK7BQVK7BQVK7BQV3SWSWT42LM/ https://www.nzherald.co.nz/nz/man-man-unlawlawlatel-det-by-military-police-rejects-nzdfs-nzdfs-sindulting-compensation-compensation-compensation offer/ZKXIZ3CFVVZEPVK7BQVK7BQVK7BQV3SWSWT42LM/ Anna LeaskIt agreed to pay the man but refused to make a formal apology. Tue, 04 Mar 2025 19:31:27 +0000 Military police have no power over civilians but caused a group of people to believe they had been detained last year. Photo / NZPA

Northland horsewoman challenges council bylaw on removing horse poo from roads https://www.nzherald.co.nz/northern-advocate/news/northland-horsewoman-challenges-challenges-council-bylaw-bylaw-on-removing-horse-horse-poooo-from-from--rom-rom-rom-room-rom-roads/zhg66666 ul5mjc6hll6hll6hll6hll6hll6wxtbe3y77xy7xqu gy https://www.nzherald.co.nz/northern-advocate/news/northland-horsewoman-challenges-challenges-council-bylaw-bylaw-on-removing-horse-horse-poooo-from-from--rom-rom-rom-room-rom-roads/zhg66666 ul5mjc6hll6hll6hll6hll6hll6wxtbe3y77xy7xqu gy Jenny LingClaire Ganantchian opposes a bylaw requiring riders to remove horse manure. Tue, 04 Mar 2025 17:00:00 +0000 Claire Ganantchian (front) pictured riding her horse Kowhai to Waitangi, believes horse riders should only pick up their horse's manure if it is safe.
Takapau Rugby Club could ‘fold’ after 140 years, with enough players for a team but not for a committee https://www.nzherald.co.nz/hawkes-bay-today/news/takapau-rugbby-club-club-club-could-could-could-fold-fold-fold-fold-fold-after-140-with-enough-enough-players-for-a-players-for-a-team-team-not-not-not-not-not-for-not-for-a-a-a-committee/ https://www.nzherald.co.nz/hawkes-bay-today/news/takapau-rugbby-club-club-club-could-could-could-fold-fold-fold-fold-fold-after-140-with-enough-enough-players-for-a-players-for-a-team-team-not-not-not-not-not-for-not-for-a-a-a-committee/ Doug Laing'It has become unsustainable for the few still involved.' Tue, 04 Mar 2025 17:00:00 +0000 Children’s rugby at Takapau’s War Memorial Park. The club is likely to go into recess if it can’t get members for its junior and club committees.
